item.title: Wait button is not working., 26th November
item.description:
Crossing at Bedford Way, Tavistock Square, Gordon Square. Outside Tavistock hotel. Press the WAIT button and all the wait buttons are illuminated red. Traffic light went through several cycles of letting cars go both ways Over a few minutes. No pedestrian crossing activated. Pedestrians were also trying to use other wait buttons at other parts of the junction. Tried button multiple times and waited. So several pedestrians crossing the road without there being the green pedestrian signal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedford Way, St Pancras, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dloud high pitch noise from a lamp - disturbs sleep, 26th November
item.description:
We hear a very loud high pitch sound from one of the lamps on our street. We can hear this sound in our house, in the rooms facing the street, and the houses on other side of the road with our neighbours. This sound is so loud it is disturbing Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clonbrock Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dirty roads, 26th November
item.description:
Wricklemarsh Road and the surrounding roads are extremely dirty with litter everywhere dog fouling on the pavement and have not been cleaned in months, I walk my dog regularly around these roads and I have never seen the area so dirty.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Corelli Road, Kidbrooke

item.title: Bus stop E in Shortlands Rd, Shortlands, Bromley about 60m S of the traffic signal junction with Bromley Rd - the bus stop red/white circular letter identifier 'E' is no longer atop the bus stop flag, but sitting on a gravel topped wall immediately adjacent to the bus shelter., 26th November
item.description:
Bus stop E in Shortlands Rd, Shortlands, Bromley about 60m S of the traffic signal junction with Bromley Rd - the bus stop red/white circular letter identifier 'E' is no longer atop the bus stop flag, but sitting on a gravel topped wall immediately adjacent to the bus shelter. I suggest that you retrieve it before someone 'runs off with it'.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
